card.name: Malware Outbreak
card.description: Widespread harmful software infecting multiple devices and systems.

card.name: Phishing Campaign
card.description: Email scam impersonating trusted entities to steal personal information and sensitive data.

card.name: DDoS (Distributed Denial of Service) Attack
card.description: Overwhelm server with traffic, blocking user access to online services and sites.

card.name: Ransomware
card.description: Malware demanding payment for system or file access; locks users' data until ransom paid.

card.name: Insider Threat
card.description: A stealthy risk originating from within, whether deliberate or accidental.

card.name: Brute Force Attack
card.description: Trial and error method to crack passwords and gain unauthorized access to systems.

card.name: Zero-Day Exploit
card.description: A just-discovered security flaw exploited by hackers before developers can address it.

card.name: Social Engineering
card.description: Deceptive tactics to manipulate individuals into divulging information or taking unauthorized actions.

card.name: Trojan Horse
card.description: Malicious software disguised as legit program to gain system access through social engineering.

card.name: Firewall
card.description: Network security device filtering traffic based on established policies between private network and Internet.

card.name: Antivirus Software
card.description: Protects, scans, detects, and removes computer viruses; offers real-time defense against attacks.

card.name: Encryption
card.description: Data scrambling for authorized understanding; plaintext to ciphertext, making information appear random.

card.name: Intrusion Detection System (IDS)
card.description: Network monitor for malicious activity, reports to security management.Can respond to intrusion.

card.name: Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)
card.description: Enhanced security system requiring two forms of ID for access, e.g., password and smartphone code.

card.name: Patch Management
card.description: Applying updates to protect against vulnerabilities and optimize system performance.

card.name: Network Monitoring
card.description: Constantly scan networks for issues to notify admins of internal problems (e.g., slow traffic, failures).

card.name: Secure Password Policy
card.description: Improves security with rules for creating and managing dependable passwords. Part of organization's regulations.

card.name: Biometric Authentication
card.description: Secure cybersecurity using unique biological traits like fingerprints, voices, retinas, and facial features for user identity verification.

card.name: Secure Socket Layer
card.description: Secure protocol enabling encrypted Internet communication through symmetric and asymmetric cryptography.

card.name: Security Patch
card.description: Software update fixing security and other issues for an organization's assets, from the manufacturer.
